trans-unit.source: Check this if the patterns here should not be used, but you don't want to delete the record either.
The name of this pattern set. Only used to make it easier for users to recognize what this record is for.

By default, only the soft hyphen and the zero width joiner (U+200D) are considered to be the characters that can make up a word. You can add additional characters making up words here. These characters are used additionally to the ones defined in the pattern file. If the pattern file does not contain a specification which characters do make up words in the language, you have to set word characters here.
The language these hyphenation patterns are for. You can have multiple pattern sets for each language, but in that case it is undefined which one is chosen.

The string to insert as a hyphen. This should usually be the HTML entity '&shy;', but you could need something else. Entities don't appear in the source code as entities, since they are decoded before echoing them out (DOMDocument likes it that way).
The minimal number of characters in a word before the first hyphen might be set.
The minimal number of characters in a word that must be left after the last hyphen is set.

The file to get the patterns from. You can get pattern files from various sources, consult the manual about details. You need to choose the correct format of your pattern file below. You can ignore the file metadata fields (title and description).
The format the pattern file has.
